p: The NMR experimental parameters were optimized to obtain clear resolution and separation of peaks (see Section 2). Methyl 3,5-dinitrobenzoate was added in NMR solvent as the internal standard of which the chemical shifts at δ 9.2 (2H, d, J = 2.13 Hz) and 9.3 ( 1H, t, J = 2.13 Hz) ppm were totally not overlapped with other peaks ( Figure 1). In the 1H NMR of Zanthoxylum samples, we excluded the up-fielded peaks in the range of δ 0.8∼2.5 ppm which were tentatively expected as the aliphatic lipids and overwhelmed other minor peaks. Therefore, we processed the down-fielded peaks in the ranges of above 3.0 ppm which were normalized by the integral of two peaks at δ 9.2 (2H, d, J = 2.13 Hz) and 9.3 ( 1H, t, J = 2.13 Hz) of the internal standard for the further study.
